summary: Chronic myelogenous leukemia (CML) is a cancer of the white blood cells, specifically a type of chronic leukemia characterized by the increased and unregulated growth of myeloid cells in the bone marrow and their accumulation in the blood. It is a clonal bone marrow stem cell disorder associated with the Philadelphia chromosome, a characteristic chromosomal translocation.
causes: Genetic change called the Philadelphia chromosome
BCR-ABL fusion gene creating an abnormal protein that allows leukemia cells to grow out of control
symptoms: Weight loss for no known reason
Pain or a feeling of fullness below the ribs on the left side
diagnosis: Fluorescent in situ hybridization (FISH) for BCR-ABL1
treatments: High-dose chemotherapy with stem cell transplant
